Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Anorectal Function and Quality of Life After Chemoradiation and Local Excision in Early Rectal Cancer

Trial_Design.evidence: In this multicentric phase II trial (ACOSOG Z6041)

Participants.evidence: patients with stage cT2N0 rectal adenocarcinomas

Intervention.evidence: treated with an oxaliplatin/capecitabine-based chemoradiation regimen followed by local excision

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates anorectal function and quality of life in T2N0 rectal cancer patients

Method_Outcome.evidence: anorectal function and quality of life were assessed at enrollment and 1 year postoperatively

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not specified.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Seventy-one patients were evaluated at enrollment and 66 at 1 year.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Seventy-one patients were evaluated at enrollment and 66 at 1 year.

Result_Outcome.evidence: No significant differences were found in Fecal Incontinence Severity Index scores at 1 year.

Harms.evidence: No significant differences were found in Fecal Incontinence Severity Index scores at 1 year.

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided.

Funding.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided.
